summary: adenoviruses (HAdVs) are pathogenic viruses that can cause acute respiratory disease (ARD), acute follicular conjunctivitis, haemorrhagic cystitis, gastroenteritis, myocarditis, meningoencephalitis, and even death. HAdVs have been classified into seven species (HAdV-A to G), which include more than 64 serotypes. a better understanding of viral genetic changes will improve two HAdV-7 strains identified in separate ARD outbreaks contained a 12-bp deletion in the VA RNA II gene. there is no clear evidence whether the VA RNA II gene mutations contributed to past HAdV-7 outbreaks. there is no clear evidence whether the VA RNA II gene mutations contributed to past HAdV-7 outbreaks. Pure Link Viral RNA/DNA Mini Kits were used to extract nucleic acids. adenovirus, coronavirus, parainfluenza virus, influenza B virus, respiratory syncytial virus A, Bordetella pertussis, Legionella pneumophila, Chlamydophila pneumoniae, Streptococcus pneumoniae, and Mycoplasma pneumoniae were detected with Seeplex®RV12 ACE and Seeplex® Pneumabacter reference genes VA RNA II and E1 were detected using primers VA-F: 5’-GAGCCAGTGCTGCGCGCGCG-3’, VA-R: 5’- TTAGAAACGTCGCGCGCGCGCG-3’. by trained medical staff and epidemiologists. all the protocols used in these investigations were approved by the Institutional Review Board of the Centre of Disease Control and Prevention of China. the whole genome was sequenced using Dideoxyterminator Sanger sequence analysis. primers used were listed in S2 Table. the sequences were aligned with MUSCLE within MEGA6.05 software. the E1 gene fragment was cloned into the T vector (pEASY-T1 Simple Cloning Kit, CT111-02; TransGen Biotech, Beijing, China) and diluted to 0.5 102–0.5 109 copies/L as standard samples. the data are presented as acute bilateral pneumonia. twenty viral strains were isolated from hospitalized positive patients. hexon, fibre, and VA RNA genes were amplified and sequenced. both hexon and fibre genes showed 100% identity with HAdV-7 isolate CQ1198. the comparison result with strain CDC228 revealed that the Z9/WH strain had some other but insignificant mutations except for VA RNA gene. phylogenetic trees based on hexon, fibre, and VA RNA gene sequences were constructed respectively. compared with strains CDC228 and XY1, the representative Wuhan strain displayed substantially higher L1 52/55K expression. substantially higher L1 52/55K expression. the latter had 12 fewer bases in the VA RNA region than the former. this outbreak brought 169 inpatients with poor conditions, like fever above 39°C (71.6%), pneumonia (45.6%) and 8 ICU (intensive care unit) cases. this outbreak brought 169 inpatients with poor conditions, like fever above 39°C (71.6%), pneumonia (45.6%) and 8 ICU (intensive care unit) cases. we first tried to measure the expression ratio between the VA RNA II and L1 52/55K gene of different HAdV-7 strains. however, given the possibility that the mutation in the VA RNA II gene might alter the expression of the gene itself, we chose instead to assess the expression of L1 52/55K against that of E1A. sequence analysis revealed several missing T in the VA RNA II terminal region. this mutation caused up-regulation of an adjacent gene, L1 52/55K. the latter promoted faster growth of the HAdV-7 strain, thus providing a causal link between the VA RNA II gene and a severe clinical outcome.
